Dear Ms. Patterson:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the Modified
Implementation, Sustainability and Exit Plan (MISEP) and your contract.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Claudia Triestram, Area Manager at (616) 552-3662.

ALLEGATION:
On 12/12/20, a staff member at the facility made inappropriate comments to a youth.
Staff member asked youth who the best masturbator on the pod was, if youth
thought another staff member was attractive, and inquired if youth was purchasing
that staff member a gift. Staff then began asking the youth a series of inappropriate
questions such as if he “pisses” in the shower. Staff then told youth if he said
anything about the discussion there would be consequences.
INVESTIGATION:
Youth A (Male, age 15) reported that Staff 1 made inappropriate comments to him.
Interviews were held at the facility on December 15, 2020 with DHHS Investigator 2.
Youth A said that on November 26, 2020, Staff 1 said while in the breakfast line to
Youth A and other youth standing waiting, “Who masturbates the best? “Youth A
said this question of Staff 1 “came out of the blue”. Youth A said that he and other
youth were uncomfortable with Staff 1’s question. Youth A said that Staff 1 said at
another time, “Do you piss in the shower?” Youth A said he answered no, and he
said Staff 1 then said, “Why not, I do” Youth A could not give a timeframe for that
comment.
Youth A asked Youth C, “How much does Youth C’s mom sucks dick?” Youth A said
Staff 1 overheard his comment to Youth C and then Staff 1 said to Youth A, “How
much does your mom suck dick?”
Youth A said that Staff 1 asked the group of youth if they thought Staff 8 “had a nice
behind?” Youth A said that Staff 1 asked him what he was going to buy Staff 8 for
her birthday. Youth A said that Staff 1 told him that Staff 8 would be the perfect
match for him, stating she could “do my dishes”.
Youth C was also interviewed on December 15, 2020 with DHHS Investigator 2. He
said that Staff 1 “asked the boys on the pod who was the best masturbator?” Youth
C said he was not sure when this occurred, but it was about 3 p.m. last month.
Youth C said that Youth A had told him about Staff 1 talking about peeing in the
shower.
Youth D and Youth B were interviewed by DHHS Investigator 2 and me on
December 15, 2020 at the facility. Youth D said that while in their rooms on
December 12, 2020 at about 8 a.m. Staff 1 said to a group of youth “Who is the best
masturbator?” Youth B said Staff 1 asked “the pod” “Who the biggest masturbator
was?” Youth B said that this occurred when they were sitting around a table on Pod
4. Youth B said he did not know why Staff 1 asked this question because they were
not talking about masturbation. Youth B said this occurred the first- or second-day
Staff 1 was assigned to the pod.

Youth A’s case file was reviewed and Staff 1’s employee file. Staff 1 began at Bay
Pines Center in September 2020. Prior to Bay Pines Center, Staff 1 worked at
Shawono Center for four and half years.
Staff 1 was interviewed on December 17, 2020 with DHHS Investigator 2 who was at
the facility and I was connected by telephone. Staff 1 admitted he did make a
comment about masturbation but was unsure when this had occurred. Staff 1 said it
was soon after he began of Boys 4. He said it was meant as a joke or icebreaker but
realized that he never should have said that. Staff 1 did not remember his exact
words, but it was to the effect, “Who is the biggest/best masturbator in this group?”
Staff 1 denied that he made comments about peeing in the shower or comments
about Staff 8. Staff 1 said about Staff 8, “She is 21 and I am 54, I am way too old for
her.”
Bay Pines Center’s policy manual was reviewed, and the following policy Staff 1
violated:
POLICY 115—STAFF ETHICS
Staff will not engage in any behavior that brings reproach upon the staff, employer,
or the State of Michigan by illegally discriminating against any individual or group
because of age, color, disability, genetic information, height, weight, marital status,
national origin, partisan considerations, race, religion, sex, or sexual orientation,
or by engaging in inappropriate, unprofessional, or unsafe relationships with facility
residents or past residents. In addition, staff will not convert state property for
personal use, and will respect both the property and rights of others.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4109 Program statement.
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents’
needs, implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of
residents.
ANALYSIS: Staff 1’s comment, which was acknowledged by all interviewed,
was not appropriate and is in violation of the facility’s policies
and procedures.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED

IV. RECOMMENDATION
It is recommended that there be no change to the licensing status of this public child
caring institution, upon the receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan which
focuses on training and close supervision of Staff 1.
